com.epoch.db

Class EnrollmentRW

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.db.DBCommon
      • com.epoch.db.EnrollmentRW

  • public final class EnrollmentRW
extends DBCommon
    Database read-write methods regarding enrollment of students in courses.

      • debugPrint

        private static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

      • getEnrolledStudents

        public static List<EnrollmentData> getEnrolledStudents(int courseId,
                                                       boolean sortByStudentNum,
                                                       String[] userLangs)
                                                throws DBException
        Gets students enrolled in a course, including TAs and unregistered students, ordered by last name and given name or by student ID number.
        Parameters:
        courseId - unique ID of this course
        sortByStudentNum - whether to sort students by student ID numbers
        userLangs - languages of this user
        Returns:
        list of EnrollmentData
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem reading the database

                                throws DBException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        list of user IDs
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem reading the database

      • getEnrolledStudents

        public static List<EnrollmentData> getEnrolledStudents(int courseId,
                                                       boolean includeTAs,
                                                       boolean includeUnregd,
                                                       boolean sortByStudentNum,
                                                       String[] userLangs)
                                                throws DBException
        Gets students enrolled in a course in alphabetical order by family name and given name or by student number.
        Parameters:
        courseId - unique ID of this course
        includeTAs - whether to include this course's TAs in the list
        includeUnregd - whether to include students not registered with ACE
        sortByStudentNum - whether to sort students by student ID numbers
        userLangs - languages of this user
        Returns:
        list of EnrollmentData
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem reading the database

      • enroll

        public static List<EnrollmentData> enroll(int courseId,
                                          EnrollmentData entry)
                                   throws DBException
        Enrolls a student in a course. Student needs not be at same institution as course owner.
        Parameters:
        courseId - unique ID of this course
        entry - an EnrollmentData
        Returns:
        list of EnrollmentData; the EnrollmentData of students who were already registered with ACE are modified
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • enroll

        public static List<EnrollmentData> enroll(int courseId,
                                          EnrollmentData[] entries,
                                          Institution institution)
                                   throws DBException
        Enrolls a list of students at a single institution in a course. All students must be at same institution as course owner.
        Parameters:
        courseId - unique ID of this course
        entries - array of EnrollmentData
        institution - school of the enrolling instructor
        Returns:
        list of EnrollmentData; the EnrollmentData of students who were already registered with ACE are modified
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

        public static void modifyTAs(int courseId,
                             List<String> userIds,
                             boolean promote)
                      throws DBException
        Promote registered students in a course to TA, or demote them from TA.
        Parameters:
        courseId - unique ID of the course
        userIds - list of login IDs of students
        promote - whether to promote or demote them
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

                                       throws DBException

        Returns:

      • transferWork

        public static void transferWork(int courseId,
                                List<String[]> students,
                                int OLD_LOGIN,
                                int NEW_LOGIN)
                         throws DBException
        Transfers work that was done in a course under one login ID to a different login ID, and deletes the first login ID. Used only in UK version.
        Parameters:
        courseId - ID number of the course containing the work to be transferred
        students - names, student ID numbers, old login IDs, and new login IDs of students whose work is to be transferred
        OLD_LOGIN - the member of students containing the old login ID
        NEW_LOGIN - the member of students containing the new login ID
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • letSeeSynthCalcdProds

        public static void letSeeSynthCalcdProds(int courseId)
                                  throws DBException
        For all users who have the same institution and student ID number as the students in a course, turns off the flag that prevents them from seeing calculated synthesis products in feedback in any course.
        Parameters:
        courseId - ID number of the course
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • setCourseSerialNos

        public static void setCourseSerialNos(List<Course> courses,
                                      String studentId)
                               throws DBException
        Sets the serial numbers of a student's courses.
        Parameters:
        courses - list of the student's courses
        studentId - the student's ID
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database
